Encounter.name: e01-cake
Encounter.Stages:
Glabbor notices you examining the cake and rushes over with a sneer on their face, "that cake is for guests only."
You flash your admission ticket. Glabbor rolls their eyes, "I don't have time for this. Don't touch anything or cause me any problems, I have a party to run." They storm off before you can respond.
You gauge the distance to the cake entirely wrong. Swinging at the air, you fall to the ground. By the time you're back on your feet, you're being escorted to the door by the guard.
You arc your hand down towards the cake and only now notice that you're aiming directly at a large candle. You yelp in pain and tend to your burnt hand as Glabbor has you escorted off the premises.
The cake goes flying everywhere, but a considerable portion lands all over a huge hulking knight. They tower over you and look ready to through a punch.
The majority of the cake splatters over Glabbor. Nearby snickers can be heard from the other guests. Glabbor has the guards take you out, one of them gives you a sympathetic high five of approval.
You look around for a good spot for far longer than you would hope to and eventually have to give up.
You underestimate just how loud your magical murmurs are, as you've drawn the attention of party guests who seem rather uneasy about your incantations. One of them informs Glabbor and you're quickly shown the door.
Someone unaware of your presence knocks you off balance and you hit your head on a table. When you come to, the spell has worn off and you were dragged outside, the patrons having assumed you were passed out drunk.
They begin to simmer down, realizing from your thoughtful words that you had meant no harm. Glabbor is less receptive to argument, however, and has you thrown out of their party.
The knight is completely uninterested in what you have to say and puts you in a chokehold.
You take a hit to the face. Not exactly your favourite thing to do.
The knight keels over in pain. The guard draws their weapon and many of the guests look afraid of you. Perhaps it's time to leave.
You're now invisible at the party. What do you do?
You find some valuables on the ground. It pays to be curious sometimes!
You find it difficult to focus with all of the commotion of the party. Nothing of value was found and it was just generally a big waste of time.
You reach for the wallet and accidentally brush against Glabbor's side. Their eyes widen and they swing around wildly, catching you in the face. Your nose starts bleeding and have to leave the party to quell it.
You rifle through Glabbor's wallet, finding some money and a book.
s-steal-glabbor-wallet-0
You pull back your first and then swing directly at the cake.
Your hand buries into the cake, sending bits flying everywhere.
Most of the debris lands on Glabbor, making them turn bright red with anger.
You find somewhere discrete to begin your spell.
You mutter some words of power.
Just like that, you begin to fade away, completely invisible to the other guests.
You look directly into the eyes of the furious knight.
You gesture towards the cake and tell them that you were merely trying to kill a fly.
Your words reach into the depths of their soul and make them feel a sense of connection that they have not felt since they were a child.
You meander your way around the party, looking for anything of value.
Darting between people as they move around and talk with one another, something on the ground catches your eye.
A coinpurse has been spilled on the ground at the other end of the party. You race over to grab it before someone notices.
The knight prepares a hefty punch and you prepare yourself.
Your raise your arms to shield yourself against the blow.
Your stance absorbs the force of the knight's attack, giving you room to hit them unexpectedly.
You take a deep breath, and prepare yourself.
Everything slows down to a crawl, you can see everything as it happens all around you.
Your hand reaches out and takes hold of the coinpurse.
